extendedIngredients.name: bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 1-1/4 lb. bok choy (about 1 large, 2 medium, or 5 to 6 baby)
extendedIngredients.originalName: bok choy (about 1 large, 2 medium, or 5 to 6 baby)

extendedIngredients.name: garlic
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: ginger
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/2-inch square of ginger, peeled and cut into thin matchsticks
extendedIngredients.originalName: ginger, peeled and cut into thin matchsticks

extendedIngredients.name: oyster sauce
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Tbs. oyster sauce (preferably Lee Kum Kee brand)
extendedIngredients.originalName: oyster sauce (preferably Lee Kum Kee brand)

extendedIngredients.name: scallions
extendedIngredients.original: 4 oz. scallions (8 to 10 medium), white and light-green parts only, cut into 3-inch lengths and halved lengthwise if thick
extendedIngredients.originalName: scallions (8 to 10 medium), white and light-green parts only, cut into 3-inch lengths and halved lengthwise if thick

title: Stir-fried Bok Choy With Garlic, Ginger, And Scallions
summary: Need a gluten free and dairy free side dish? Stir-fried Bok Choy With Garlic, Ginger, And Scallions could be a spectacular recipe to try. For 92 cents per serving, this recipe covers 19% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 127 calories, 3g of protein, and 10g of fat. This recipe serves 3. This recipe from finecooking.com has 20 fans. Head to the store and pick up ginger, cornstarch, kosher salt, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 96%. This score is tremendous.
